snippet: The new Doctors Without Borders treatment unit, a series of large white tents, is designed to hold an initial 120 patients and then to be expanded to accept up to 400.
abstract: Doctors Without Borders will begin accepting patients at new treatment center in Liberia; facility, composed of a series of white tents, is designed to hold an initial 120 patients and will be expanded to accommodate up to 400; opening comes day after an improvised holding center was overrun by protesters.
lead_paragraph: The new Doctors Without Borders treatment unit, a series of large white tents, is designed to hold an initial 120 patients and then to be expanded to accept up to 400.

headline.main: Liberia Expanding Space for Ebola Patient Care
headline.print_headline: Liberia Expanding Space for Ebola Patient Care
